channel.title: CVE Feed for Spring -- Spring Security
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Spring -- Spring Security

item.title: CVE-2019-11272|2024-09-16T19:25:59.208Z -- spring -- spring%20security
item.description: Spring Security, versions 4.2.x up to 4.2.12, and older unsupported versions support plain text passwords using PlaintextPasswordEncoder. If an application using an affected version of Spring Security is leveraging PlaintextPasswordEncoder and a user has a null encoded password, a malicious user (or attacker) can authenticate using a password of "null".

item.title: CVE-2024-38810|2024-08-20T13:34:50.068Z -- spring -- spring%20security
item.description: Missing Authorization When Using @AuthorizeReturnObject in Spring Security 6.3.0 and 6.3.1 allows attacker to render security annotations inaffective.

item.title: CVE-2024-38810|2024-08-20T03:35:24.795Z -- spring -- spring%20security
item.description: Missing Authorization When Using @AuthorizeReturnObject in Spring Security 6.3.0 and 6.3.1 allows attacker to render security annotations inaffective.
